sen.j: 大宮 伊治（おおみや これはる、明応5年（1496年）－天文 (元号)20年8月28日 (旧暦)（1551年9月28日））は、戦国時代 (日本)の官人。
sen.e: Koreharu OMIYA (1496 - September 28, 1551) was a government official in the Sengoku period (Japan).
Koreharu OMIYA (1496 - September 28, 1551) was a government official in the Sengoku period (Japan).
Koreharu OMIYA (1496 - October 8, 1551) was a government official in the Sengoku period (period of Warring States).
sen.cmt: ユリウス→グレゴリオ暦に修正しい、「戦国時代」→統一リストに基づき修正

sen.j: 大宮官務家最後の当主。
sen.e: He was the last head of Omiya Kanmu family.
He was the last head of the Omiya Kanmu family.
He was the last head of the Omiya Kanmu family.

sen.j: 本姓が小槻氏であることから小槻 伊治（おづきのこれはる）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: He was also called Ozuki no Koreharu because his real family name was Ozuki clan.
He was also called Ozuki no Koreharu because his real family name was of the Ozuki clan.
He was also called OZUKI no Koreharu because his real family name was of the Ozuki clan.
sen.cmt: Ozuki no Koreharu→OZUKI no Koreharuに修正

sen.e: His first name was Sadayasu.
His first name was Sadayasu.
His first name was Sadayasu.

sen.j: 官務・算博士大宮時元の子。
sen.e: He was a son of Tokimoto OMIYA, Kanmu (head of Benkankyoku (governmnt office which administerd provincial governors))/San hakase (Doctor of Numbers).
He was a son of Tokimoto OMIYA, Kanmu (head of Benkankyoku (governmnt office which administerd provincial governors))/San hakase (Doctor of Numbers).
He was a son of Tokimoto OMIYA, Kanmu (head of Benkankyoku (governmnt office which administerd provincial governors))/San hakase (Doctor of Numbers).

sen.j: 永正9年（1512年）に従五位上に叙され、4年後に正五位下に叙される。
sen.e: He was conferred Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1512 and four years later, he was conferred Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was conferred Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1512 and four years later, he was conferred Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was conferred Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1512 and four years later, he was conferred Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 永正17年4月11日 (旧暦)（1520年4月28日）に父・時元が没する。
sen.e: His father Tokimoto died on April 28, 1520.
His father Tokimoto died on April 28, 1520.
His father Tokimoto died on May 8, 1520.
sen.cmt: ユリウス→グレゴリオ暦に修正

sen.j: 大永元年（1521年）に史 (律令制)（官務）となり、翌年に算博士に転じる。
sen.e: He became Shi (Ritsuryo system) (Kanmu) in 1521 and shifted to San hakase in the next year.
He became Shi (Ritsuryo system) (Kanmu) in 1521 and shifted to San hakase in the next year.
He became Shi (Ritsuryo system) (Kanmu) in 1521 and shifted to San hakase in the next year.

sen.j: 享禄2年（1529年）に『御成敗式目』の版本を刊行している（日本における法律書の出版の嚆矢とされる）。
sen.e: He published "Goseibai-shikimoku" in 1529 (this book is regarded as the first law book published in Japan).
He published "Goseibai-shikimoku" in 1529 (this book is regarded as the first law book published in Japan).
He published "Goseibai-shikimoku" in 1529 (this book is regarded as the first law book published in Japan).

sen.j: 天文7年（1537年）には正四位上に叙せられ、天文13年（1544年）には尾張国国司に任ぜられる。
sen.e: He was conferred Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1537 and was appointed to the provincial governor of Owari Province.
He was conferred Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1537 and was appointed to the provincial governor of Owari Province.
He was conferred Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1537 and was appointed to the provincial governor of Owari Province.

sen.j: だが、応仁の乱以後、官務と小槻氏宗家の地位を争う壬生家壬生家（小槻姓）に押されていた伊治は周防国の大内義隆を頼って下向する。
sen.e: After the Onin War, however, Koreharu went to Suo Province seeking the support of Yoshitaka OUCHI, because he then lost ground to the Mibu family Mibu family (family name was Ozuki) with which he competed the position of Kanmu and the head of Ozuki clan.
sen.cmt: 壬生家壬生家→重複しているかと思いますが、そのままにしております。
sen.e: After the Onin War, however, Koreharu went to Suo Province seeking the support of Yoshitaka OUCHI, because he then lost ground to the Mibu family (family name was Ozuki) with which he competed for the position of Kanmu and the head of Ozuki clan.

After the Onin War, however, Koreharu went to Suo Province seeking the support of Yoshitaka OUCHI, because he then lost ground to the Mibu family (family name was Ozuki) with which he competed for the position of Kanmu and the head of Ozuki clan.

sen.j: 娘は義隆の寵愛を受けて側室となり、跡継ぎとなる大内義尊を儲けた。
sen.e: His daughter won Yoshitaka's favor and gave birth to Yoshitaka OUCHI, a successor.
His daughter won Yoshitaka's favor and gave birth to Yoshitaka OUCHI, a successor.
His daughter won Yoshitaka's favor and gave birth to Yoshitaka OUCHI, a successor.

sen.j: だが、天文21年（1551年）、主君・義隆に対して挙兵した陶隆房の軍に襲撃されて殺害される（大寧寺の変）。
sen.e: In 1551, however, he was assaulted and killed by the force of Takafusa SUE, who rebelled against his master Yoshitaka (Daineiji no hen (the revolt of Daineiji)).
In 1551, however, he was assaulted and killed by the force of Takafusa SUE, who rebelled against his master Yoshitaka (Daineiji no hen (the revolt of Daineiji)).
In 1551, however, he was assaulted and killed by the force of Takafusa SUE, who rebelled against his master Yoshitaka (Daineiji no hen (the revolt of Daineiji)).

sen.j: ここに大宮官務家は断絶し、以後壬生家壬生家（小槻姓）が明治維新まで官務を世襲することとなった。
sen.e: The Omiya Kanmu family ceased to exist at the time and since then, the Mibu family the Mibu family (family name was Ozuki) inherited the position of Kanmu until the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: 壬生家壬生家→重複しているかと思いますが、そのままにしております。
sen.e: The Omiya Kanmu family ceased to exist at the time and since then, the Mibu family (family name was Ozuki) inherited the position of Kanmu until the Meiji Restoration.
The Omiya Kanmu family ceased to exist at the time and since then, the Mibu family (family name was Ozuki) inherited the position of Kanmu until the Meiji Restoration.
